Empires & Puzzles Ciara Review: The Exacting Commander

Ciara brings strict standards to the battlefield with her heavy-hitting Spear Guard Mega Minion. While her AoE damage is modest, her ability to dispel buffs with every minion hit makes her a relentless tactical threat. Is she the commander your roster needs?
Ciara: The Exacting Commander of Dispel
Ciara: The No-Nonsense Commander of the Garrison

Ciara is a 5-star Ice (Blue) hero from the Garrison Guards family, released in May 2025. As a Paladin class hero with Fast mana speed, she fits the archetype of a rapid-response utility attacker. Unlike the sheer nukers of the past, Ciara combines moderate Area of Effect (AoE) damage with the powerful Garrison mechanic: the Mega Minion. She doesn't just hit you; she summons a bodyguard that continues to harass and strip buffs from enemies long after her turn ends. In an era dominated by complex status effects, her straightforward approach of "hit them and take away their toys" is refreshing, if a bit utilitarian.

Ciara's design screams authority. Clad in polished plate armor with the blue and white heraldry of the Garrison, she stands ready to enforce order. The horns and elven ears suggest a lineage that is more than human, perhaps hinting at the magical nature of the Mega Minions she commands. The art style is crisp and consistent with the "castle defense" theme of the family, though some might argue it lacks the flashy particle effects of the Astral or Construct families. She looks like someone who reads the rulebook to you before hitting you with it.

With 1248 Attack, 1180 Defense, and 2090 Health, Ciara's stats are solid but are beginning to show the very first signs of age compared to the absolute cutting edge of late 2025. For comparison, the recently released Aether Mimic boasts stats like 1332/1332/2259. However, Ciara is far from obsolete. Her health pool breaks the 2k barrier comfortably, which is crucial for her Mega Minion's durability. She sits in the "High Modern" tier—not quite breaking records anymore, but certainly not a liability on the battlefield.

Ciara's special skill, "Strict Standards," is a two-part tactical strike. First, she deals 200% damage to all enemies. At Fast speed, this is a decent "soften them up" move, though it rarely wipes a team on its own. The real power lies in the second effect: the Spear Guard Mega Minion.

This isn't your average minion. It inherits a massive 300% of Ciara's attack and 35% of her HP. More importantly, every time this Mega Minion hits an enemy (which happens automatically at the end of the turn), it dispels

dispellable buffs from that target. This provides a continuous, passive dispel source that can disrupt buff-heavy defenses without you needing to cast a special skill every turn. It turns her into a lingering threat that demands an answer.
Let's break down what "Strict Standards" actually means on the field.
. She charges in 8 tiles (7 with minimal mana support), allowing her to deploy her Mega Minion early in the fight.
spread across 5 enemies. It's a "chip damage" AoE, meant to strip defensive layers rather than execute.
. This is a very beefy shield for Ciara, absorbing significant incoming fire.
. Note: This is the stat used for the minion's hit calculation. A minion hitting with nearly 3800 attack power is devastating, often hitting harder than many heroes' tile damage.
Continuous. As long as the minion lives, one enemy per turn loses their buffs.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Garrison Guards are defined by their resilience and their summoned allies. Ciara comes with a set of passives that enhance her durability and utility.

While the Garrison Guards don't always have a traditional "stat boost" family bonus listed in the same way as older families, their strength lies in the synergy of their Mega Minions. (Note: Specific stat bonuses for the family are not explicitly detailed in the provided data, but the shared "Mega Minion" mechanic is the core identity).
This is huge in a meta filled with mana controllers. Being immune to mana cuts ensures she fires when you expect her to, maintaining her tempo.

Every 4 turns, she cleanses Wither effects from all allies. With Wither becoming a common debilitation from recent hero families (like the Constructs or recent dark heroes), having a passive cleanse for it is a subtle but powerful advantage that keeps your team's stats healthy.

. This is a simple but effective choice for her. Since her Mega Minion inherits her attack stat, boosting Ciara's attack directly buffs the minion's damage output. It reinforces her role as a summoner of high-damage entities.
Released in mid-2025, Ciara arrived when Mega Minions were becoming a staple. She was seen as a solid, if somewhat safe, addition to the family—a reliable Fast AoE hero.

Six months later, her 200% direct damage feels a little light compared to the 400%+ hits we see from Slower heroes or the complex effects of newer ones. However, the Mega Minion mechanic scales well. A 700+ HP meat shield is always useful, and a 300% attack hit is significant regardless of the meta.

, particularly in PvP offense and farming. She serves as an excellent counter to buff-heavy teams (like those relying on Taunt or Riposte) because her minion can strip those buffs without using mana. She isn't the flashy "win button" of December 2025, but she is a workhorse who gets the job done.
At the time of this review, Ciara does not have a costume.
Ciara is a Paladin, which naturally boosts her defense. However, her unique mechanic demands a specific approach.
The Spear Guard Mega Minion inherits HP and Attack from Ciara. Maximizing Attack makes the minion hit like a truck. Maximizing Health makes the minion (and Ciara) harder to kill.
Slightly lower personal defense for Ciara, though the Paladin talent helps mitigate this.
Makes Ciara extremely tanky, ensuring she survives to cast multiple times.
The Mega Minion becomes less of a threat and more of just a meat shield.
path is recommended. The value of a 300% attack inheritor is too high to ignore. You want that minion to be a threat, not just a nuisance.
The Mega Minion dispels on hit, providing a constant stream of utility that saves you from needing a dedicated dispeller active at all times.
She charges quickly, allowing her to put pressure on the enemy early in the match.
The Spear Guard is exceptionally strong, acting as both a high-damage extra attack and a significant health buffer.
Innate resistance to mana reduction is a top-tier defensive perk.
The 200% AoE hit is relatively weak by modern standards and won't kill healthy enemies.
Much of her value is tied to the minion. If the enemy has heavy minion counters (like Grimsteel or newer anti-minion heroes), her effectiveness drops sharply.
You cannot control who the Mega Minion hits (and thus, who gets dispelled) at the end of the turn.
Her Fast AoE combined with a hard-hitting minion makes her excellent for clearing waves quickly. The minion usually finishes off whatever the AoE didn't.
Great against teams that rely on buffs. She can strip a Taunt or Defense Up automatically.
The Mega Minion acts as a pseudo-heal by providing a health buffer, which is invaluable when healing is disabled.
Ironically decent here; even if the minion is removed or buffs are wiped, she fires fast enough to re-apply pressure.
Ciara works best when she is not the sole damage dealer. She is a "setup" and "sustain" attacker.
Pair her with other Mega Minion summoners (like Flip or other Garrison heroes). The multiple Mega Minions overwhelm the enemy with high-stat bodies that soak damage.
Ciara + heavy hitters (e.g., a strong Sniper). Ciara strips defensive buffs (like Defense Up or Counterattack) with her minion, leaving the target vulnerable for the sniper to finish off.
Ciara + other Fast AoE heroes. Her animation is relatively quick, and the minion cleans up stragglers, making for efficient stage clearing.
Heroes who destroy minions instantly (e.g., Grimsteel, certain Lunar heroes) are her worst nightmare. They delete her primary utility.
Heroes who steal minions turn her greatest asset against you.
Anyone who blocks minion summoning shuts her down almost completely, leaving her as a weak 200% hitter.

If you pulled Ciara early, you have a gem. She effectively gives you a 6th team member (the minion) who hits hard. Prioritize leveling her Attack stat to get the most out of that minion. She can serve as your main tank or flank in lower arenas simply because new players will struggle to chew through her high HP minion.

Ciara is a luxury utility pick. You likely have harder hitters, but do you have a Fast speed passive dispeller? Use her in War teams where you expect to face pesky buffers. She is worth Limit Breaking (LB1) for the stats, but think twice about LB2 (Alpha Aethers) unless you heavily rely on her for competitive wars; there are flashier options for those precious resources.
The community reaction to Ciara was mixed, leaning towards "solid but uninspired."
Many players expressed fatigue with the Garrison mechanic:
"I’m so bored with these Garrison Guard heroes... just deal some damage and summon a mega minion."
There was also some grumbling about her stats being adjusted from Beta:
"I was probably one of the beta reasons her mega minion got 50% damage nerf but now regretting it."
Despite the "boring" label, players admitted she is effective:
"They’re everywhere at the top of Diamond."

Ciara is the office manager of Empires & Puzzles. She isn't the life of the party, and she definitely follows the rules, but the office falls apart without her. Her ability to consistently strip buffs and absorb damage makes her a reliable, if unexciting, cornerstone for many attacking teams. She doesn't need to be flashy; she just needs to be effective. And effective she is.

A solid asset for any roster, particularly valuable for players needing reliable dispel and survivability. Keep her, level her, but maybe don't expect her to win beauty contests for "Most Innovative Mechanic."
